entry.p: The system uses memory when it is running. There is a direct correlation between the memory occupancy rate and service types as well as operating data. The memory monitoring module in this product monitors how memory is used in the system, and supports two levels of threshold value prompts.When memory reaches the upper limit set for the first level, the system issues a prompt to you in the form of a yellow warning which states that current memory use has reached the upper limit.When memory reaches the upper limit set for the second level, the system issues a prompt to you in the form of a red error which states that current memory use has reached the upper limit.

Memory is a limited resource. When memory utilization reaches the preset limit, the system status bar issues a prompt which states that memory use has reached the upper limit. You can increase available memory by closing examinations that are using a large amount of data.

The systems needs to use disks to run.There is a direct correlation between disk occupancy rate and data volume stored in the system. The disk monitoring module in this product monitors remaining disk space in the image storage area, and supports two levels of threshold value prompts. When remaining disk space reaches the upper limit set for the first level, the disk space icon is displayed in yellow to alert you that disk use has reached the set upper limit. When remaining disk space reaches the upper limit set for the second level, the disk space icon is displayed in red to alert you that disk use has reached the set limit value.

Disks are a limited resource. When disk utilization reaches the preset limit, the system issues a prompt to you of the disk status. You then needs to clean the disk or storage volume to increase avail-able space in the disk or storage volume.

The system needs to communicate with other devices when obtaining and sending data. Therefore, the network communication function needs to be used. The network monitoring module of this product monitors network connection status. When the network connection status changes, you is alerted. When the network is disconnected, the icon is displayed in red to alert you that the network connection has failed. When the network connection is recovered, the icon is displayed in gray to alert you that the network connection has been recovered.

If the network is not connected, the sys-tem cannot receive data from other devices and cannot send data to other devices. You can check whether the cable socket is loose, whether the cable is damaged, and whether relevant devices are working normally; if so, you can tighten and change the cable, or repair or change the broken network devices to get the system running nor-mally again.
